summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan granting Ghislaine Maxwell access to her legal materials while she is held in the courthouse cellblock and transported to the U.S. Attorney's office for evidence review during a specified week in April 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (S2 20 Cr. 330) who is ordered to be permitted access to her legal materials while in custody at the courthouse.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the order directing the U.S. Marshal to permit Ghislaine Maxwell access to her legal materials.

connections.description: Judge Nathan issued a court order regarding the conditions of Maxwell's custody and access to legal materials.

events.title: Court Order for Legal Material Access
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan orders the U.S. Marshal to permit Ghislaine Maxwell to have access to her legal materials while she is in the courthouse cellblock and being transported for evidence review.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
U.S. Attorney's office on the 5th floor
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody and being held in a courthouse cellblock in April 2021.
Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order to allow Maxwell access to her legal materials during her time in the cellblock and while being transported for evidence review.
The order indicates Maxwell was involved in evidence review proceedings with the U.S. Attorney's office during that week.
